awd_titl_txt: Mathematical Sciences: Estimation in Nonlinear              Heteroscedastic Regression Models
awd_abstract_narration: This research involves the study of fitting statistical                    nonlinear regression models to data for which the response                      variance has been modeled as a function of the mean response and                other variables and possible unknown parameters which must be                   estimated from the data. Estimation will be studied for repeated                measures data in which the response variance varies within                      individuals.  A heteroscedastic random coefficient model                        containing a functional model for intra-individual variance with                unknown parameters to be estimated is considered. Systematic                    study of the implications of the theory of variance function                    estimation for data consisting of independent observations will                 be conducted. Estimation for regression analysis with censored                  data will be studied when a variance function model is                          postulated. These models are applied to a detection limit problem               common in pharmaceutical applications.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
